channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Where the law stands 30 years after a woman sued McDonald's for spilling hot coffee
item.description: NPR's David Folkenflik talks with Catherine Sharkey about the 30th anniversary of the McDonald's hot coffee lawsuit decision and its legacy.
item.content:encoded: NPR's David Folkenflik talks with Catherine Sharkey about the 30th anniversary of the McDonald's hot coffee lawsuit decision and its legacy.
item.dc:creator: David Folkenflik

item.title: Harris and Trump zero in on the economy in campaign speeches
item.description: The economy was a major theme last week for both presidential campaigns. We hear some of what was said.
item.content:encoded: The economy was a major theme last week for both presidential campaigns. We hear some of what was said.
item.dc:creator: David Folkenflik

item.title: How Biden's debate performance snowballed into Harris becoming the new candidate
item.description: NPR's David Folkenflik speaks with Wall Street Journal reporter Annie Linskey about how the White House and press have handled President Biden's capabilities related to his age.
item.content:encoded: NPR's David Folkenflik speaks with Wall Street Journal reporter Annie Linskey about how the White House and press have handled President Biden's capabilities related to his age.
item.dc:creator: David Folkenflik

item.title: Ukraine's incursion into Russia may have changed the course of the war
item.description: NPR’s David Folkenflik speaks to strategic studies professor Phillips O’Brien of the University of St. Andrews in Scotland about the significance of Ukraine’s military incursion into Russia.
item.content:encoded: NPR’s David Folkenflik speaks to strategic studies professor Phillips O’Brien of the University of St. Andrews in Scotland about the significance of Ukraine’s military incursion into Russia.
item.dc:creator: David Folkenflik

item.title: As Democrats meet in Chicago, Illinois' role in abortion access is in the spotlight
item.dc:creator: Sarah McCammon

item.title: Politics chat: The Harris-Walz campaign is gearing up for the DNC
item.description: After a whirlwind four weeks, Democrats gather in Chicago at the DNC to rally around the new Harris-Walz ticket.
item.content:encoded: After a whirlwind four weeks, Democrats gather in Chicago at the DNC to rally around the new Harris-Walz ticket.
item.dc:creator: David Folkenflik

item.title: The Promise Keepers, a 1997 evangelical men's group, is back with a new agenda
item.description: An evangelical Christian men’s group is trying to make a comeback with a new, more explicitly political agenda.
item.content:encoded: An evangelical Christian men’s group is trying to make a comeback with a new, more explicitly political agenda.
item.dc:creator: Elizabeth Caldwell

item.title: The largest branch in American Judaism now ordains rabbis in interfaith marriages
item.description: For the first time, the largest branch in American Judaism has agreed to ordain rabbis who are in interfaith marriages.
item.content:encoded: For the first time, the largest branch in American Judaism has agreed to ordain rabbis who are in interfaith marriages.
item.dc:creator: Deena Prichep

item.title: How growing up in the U.S. immigration system shapes how these young Americans vote
item.description: NPR met with a group of five young people who have experiences with the U.S. immigration system to talk about how their identity and family story affect how they see the 2024 election.
item.content:encoded:
NPR met with a group of five young people who have experiences with the U.S. immigration system to talk about how their identity and family story affect how they see the 2024 election.

(Image credit: Joseph Bui for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Elena Moore

item.title: A dark musical comedy about witches has Ukraine enthralled. Here's why
item.description: Witches are having a moment in Ukraine. Now they have taken center stage in a dark musical comedy titled The Witch of Konotop, with performances selling out all summer in Kyiv.
item.content:encoded:
Witches are having a moment in Ukraine. Now they have taken center stage in a dark musical comedy titled The Witch of Konotop, with performances selling out all summer in Kyiv.

(Image credit: Ivan Franko Theater)
item.dc:creator: Ashley Westerman
